Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sudeep
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at petra couple of times on work related issues, i could recommed the hotel. The restaurant is pretty good and the people at reception are very kind. Though not close to the city center and when on work, i prefer to be here as they have shuttle, Internet services etc.. all included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “few good reasons”
Reviews.Author: Aspi123
Reviews.Content: reasonably priced, but in isolated area. to go to rome,take bus to train station and then metro. supermarket 15 mins walk. nice pool & tennis court. aircon in room not working well. room service is extra charge. no breakfast. kitchen facilities were normal. good gym. parking free. wifi charge was 10 euros daily but we got it free as we were there for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamapafi
Reviews.Content: I'va stayed in the hotel with my wife and 3 kids. The hotel is nice and clean asyou would expect from a 4 star hotel. Sitiuated 10 min drive from a Ciampino Airport makes it a very convinient hotel for stay between flights. There is a swimming pool outside the hotel. The food in the restaurant is avarage at the best and rather overprized.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, terrible management”
Reviews.Author: copace1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here 2 nights with a group of high school kids. Unfortunately, there happened to be a group of young soccer players in this hotel. We were disgusted with how the management handled our situation. The young boys were making very inappropriate comments to our girls, calling their rooms in the middle of the night, etc. After we were informed of this, we asked the front desk to do something. They replied, "Boys will be boys." The kids continued their behavior, forcing us to sit in the hallway outside our girls' rooms until almost 4 in the morning when the boys finally stopped roaming the halls and went to bed. Maybe that is how young boys treat young girls in Italy, but we were not going to allow our girls to be treated that way. So, in conclusion, the hotel is actually pretty nice and they have a great breakfast, but if you want a place where the management won't put up with nonsense, I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with this one”
Reviews.Author: Aussie086
Reviews.Content: In brief - the hotel is some distance from the City centre with all it's attractions. Taxis each way will cost around 40-50Euros. We did not use public transport. The area in which the hotel is situated is very dodgy looking and run-down. An apartment close by had a noisy student party until dawn. Someone else here describes the hotel as being "like an old-style Travel Inn" which is spot on! The hotel's website portrays it as looking bright and new - it is now very old. The pool (of which I will attach a photo) is closed, green and derelict. It obviously has been out of use for some time, with no plans to re-open it. Room was clean, staff were generally pleasant and spoke enough English to understand us thankfully! Room had 3 single beds (we were a couple with one child) Internet in room was expensive. The one meal we had in the main hotel restaurant was fine, but slow in coming. Breakfast is held upstairs and is light continental. This hotel would be fine if you have no expectations, and want to save a few quid by staying well outside the city. But you would have to use the metro to keep the costs down.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Darzy
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Petra Hotel and residence was a pleasant one indeed. I was a bit skeptical to begin with due to the other reviews but my room just right. Even though I travelled solo I booked a double room and I was not disappointed. The room was spacious and clean, heating was very good and the bathroom clean. For the price I paid I am not complaining, I stayed in hotels where I paid much more and received poorer service. The lobby is modern and quite stylish, the reception staff very kind and spoke English really well. The location of the hotel is not in the city centre but not too far either. I just caught bus 46 from stop ‘Schiavonetti’ to ‘Anagnina’ metro station and from there caught the train to Roma Termini station. I preferred to catch public transport and not to stay in the city. I would not advise anyone to drive there unless they have had several years experience driving in Europe. The hotel is not too far from Ciampino Airport, which offers a shuttle bus for 1.20 Euro p/p + 1.20 Euro for large luggage to Anagnina metro station. From Leonardo Da Vinci airport simply catch the Leonardo express to Roma termini station (14 euro) and then Line A to the end (Anagnina).

Reviews.Title: “The only option available”
Reviews.Author: prahneva
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in the last possible minute. There were two big events in Rome - U2 concert and Finals of Volleyball world championship and all Roma hotels were blocked. The hotel is far away from the city center. You can reach Rome with bus and metro for about 35-50 minutes depending on the waiting time at the bus stop. If you have a car - you can go to Anagnina metro station and park there at the free parking. The rooms were OK - need some repairs but large enough. Bathrooms are also OK. It's not noisy, so you can have a good sleep. We had a problem with the dinner. The hotel restaurant was working until 10 PM and it was very expensive. We asked for a place arround the hotel - no answer from the staff. There was a recommendation to ask people but there was nobody at the street. So, we started exploring the area and we finally succeeded. The place is called Pizzaria Stravinskij - very close to the hotel, the address is Largo Alfonso Favino, 15 and is situated between the residential area. The place is perfect - new one, with perfect kitchen, working until 11:30 PM and full with local people. You can see the way to the Pizzaria in the attached picture.

Reviews.Title: “horrible service - totaly unrecommended”
Reviews.Author: vara75
Reviews.Content: Here is our story on Petra Hotel: My wife and I and our 1 year son booked this hotel in June 2010 for 5 night for 16th to 21st September. They replied and confirmed the booking and kindly asked if we need even a baby bed in our room. Also they mentioned that they need no advance payment but they'll charge the first night of our booking from our credit card in the case of not showing. Ok, that was perfectly fine for us. When we reached the hotel though, after one train jurney from Fiuminino to Termini, one metro jurney from there to Ananina - the last station and one late bus from here to the hotel, the receptionist said our credit card was not valid so they had to cancel the reservation. Obviously was a big lie because they weren't suppose to charge our card or even check it as song as we were there on the day of our booking. And secondly, we booked our flight tickets to Rome from the same card, so the card was ok. Anyhow, they refused to check us in. The situation was horrible - in a huge city, far from the center having a 1 year old baby with you... it was the worst experience ever. And belive me, we are experience travellers, working in tourism. Anyhow, be very careful with Petra hotel - you can not trust this people at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: happyholiday55
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend in Rome. We booked it as a last minute thing, so had limited options when choosing a hotel. Booked Hotel Petra as 1. It had a room available 2. It looked great on the website 3.It was (just) within our budget. Firstly, yes, it's miles from Rome - to get there from the city itself you must get the metro to the furthest stop, Anagnina which takes 20-25 mins from the main terminal (the Metro is clean & efficient and a 75 min pass only costs 1 euro from the machine) from there to the hotel you have 2 options, the number 46 bus which runs every 15 mins and drops off 150 metres from the hotel, or the local taxis - DO NOT use these unless your very tired or in a desperate rush as they are a rip off ! The first time we were charged 13 euros for what is about a 2 mile journey and the second time the driver shot off at 80 mph in the wrong direction! After i protested he turned around, took us to the hotel but still insisted on taking 15 euros from me. The Hotel offers a shuttle bus, this is not, as it states, a free service. You can use it at 9am or 10.15 in the morning and twice again in the evening, and that's it. We were told by the receptionist, who was rude and abrupt with us throughout the stay, that this service was at a cost of 5 euros per person each way. We used it the first day, until we found the bus, there were 6 people in the shuttle bus that day, all paying 5 euros each so the 30 euros they made for the 2 mile trip made the taxis look reasonable!! First impressions of the Hotel, it needs a make-over and a gardener - all a bit shabby but the pool area is nice and once you're in, the reception is clean & tidy. As mentioned, the receptionist was rude, un helpful and abrupt but the bar staff and waitresses ( they have to do both jobs so if the restaurant is busy don't stand at the bar - you will have a long wait) ! were pleasant and helpfull. Felt sorry for them, they are woefully understaffed, three staff must have done 120 meals that night and as i say, had to look after the bar as well ! We booked B&B but on checking into the hotel the receptionist said breakfast was to be charged extra untill i argued otherwise and he backed down. Also tried to charge us 5 euros each when i asked for a towell for the pool, later saying it was just a deposit when we questioned this charge. The rooms are ok, think old style travel lodge without the tea/coffe making facilities, small, but clean & tidy and they have a balcolny with poolside view if thats your fancy. Breakfast was typical continental but with a good choice and decent selection of teas/coffees. Evening meal, expensive, but Italy is. The food it self was delicious, had Carbonara & Fillet steak, the steak was fantastic and their was a good choice of local wines. We ate there twice but we found a great little Pizzeria about 250 meters away, difficult to find but if you ask, someone will direct you, it's literaly the only place nearby to eat but it's where all the locals go. PS There is a mini market just around the corner where you can get all your essentials, beer and wine (2 euros a bottle)!

Reviews.Title: “Depends on your room”
Reviews.Author: JohannaGuerrero
Reviews.Content: Frankly, we stayed in this hotel just to save money, it’s quite good but is very far from the city centre and from the subway, but there is a bus stop next to it or you could leave your car on the hotel’s parking space, as we did. The room we were accommodated first was an apartment with a kitchenette equipped with a microwave and a fridge, though it was humid and one wall was moulded. To take a shower you should stay right on the floor, there wasn’t a screen in the shower, only a curtain. When they gave us another room it was much better, but there wasn’t a kitchenette in it. The staff was ok, someone was friendly, other not so much, but always polite. To sum up, the hotel is ok if you want to save money and have enough time to move by car and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: onlygod
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Rooms are good, breakfast was ok, not a big range, but good quality. Recepetion staff were very helpful and can speak in english without problems. The bonus is the free shuttle to nearby places. The only negative thing is the location, it is outside the centre, but the bus stop is right in front of the hotel, jump onto the 046 bus and go to the metro station which is a 5 minute drive. From there, the metro takes 30 minutes to the centre of the city. Overall, not bad, it's well connected to the city, the neighbourhood around it has nothing in it, so you have to go to the city for anything.

Reviews.Title: “nice pool”
Reviews.Author: salsachick27
Reviews.Content: We (myself and bf) arrived at 9pm on a Sunday night after being picked up by the hotel limousine service. The area we drove through to get to it was less than desirable but thought it would be better by day. We asked the hotel receptionist for advice on transport to Rome and were given info and a map. Dinner on the first night was less than satisfactory - ordered grilled chicken and that is just what you got - a piece of chicken on a plate and nothing else - luckily ordered chips too. Used the bus and metro to get into Rome the next day - the hotel sold tickets which lasted 75 mins for 1 euro, and we bought a weekly ticket from Anagnina metro station which served all buses, metros and trams for just 16 Euros each - good value. The info given to us about metros etc by the hotel was incorrect - they said the last metro from Rome was 9pm then it changed to a bus - it's actually 11:30pm! Due to being told this we got taxis home the first 2 nights until we discovered the truth. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere really - taxi drivers in Rome don't know how to get there - one used an a-z whilst driving (as if Italian driving isn't bad enough) and the other used his sat nav. Taxi costs varied between 28 and 35 Euros depending on which way they went. The pool area was good - good sun loungers and 3 big umbrellas at one end of the pool, and it was secure - had to use key card to get in. The pool is a decent size and is quite deep - I’m 5'11" and don't swim, but when I stepped off the last step the water was over my shoulders - another foot or so into the pool and it was up to my neck. We didn't eat at the hotel for the rest of the week until the Friday when we ordered some chips in the bar - very helpful girl on the bar - brought them to us with sauces etc. Different story the next day when a young guy was on - said it wasn't possible to have food in bar - have to eat in restaurant but then have to pay 1.5 Euros each service charge! Already unhappy, we went back to our room to get things ready for our departure the next day, when we went into the room safe to find 160 Euros missing! Reception called the manager who offered to pay for the meal we'd had on our first night and our taxi back to the airport (instead of another meal which they had offered and we declined). They told us to go to the police station and gave us directions, but when we asked for them to call them out to the hotel we were offered a lift there - guess they didn't want the police at the hotel! Still no idea what happened to the money. The rooms are clean with a nice balcony area, TV which only has 2 channels in English - both news channels, hairdryer in bathroom was good - didn't even need to use my travel dryer. Not sure what time the room attendants started but our room was never ready before 3 or 4pm each day. Overall, staff were friendly, pool was clean, and rooms were clean. Maybe a bit far from Rome if you want to go in during day and back at night as you do spend a lot of time waiting for buses etc, but it is good if you want to do sightseeing for a few days and then spend time chilling by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Petra”
Reviews.Author: judelewis64
Reviews.Content: Everything you need in a hotel, clean, helpful staff, and a nice restaurant. Plus balconies with views of the pool and no traffic noise. On the outskirts of Rome with excellent nearby public transport links into the city centre (about 30 minutes). We had a great stay in Rome and can definitely recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: World_Citizen8
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Spotless rooms - Top-notch restaurant - Reasonnable rates Cons: - Location not ideal for tourists, i.e. not in central Rome - Air con was not working in my room - Minibar fridge was barely working - Laundry showed up 2 days later with several oily dark brown spots on my shirts - Hotel shuttle bus systematically late or not even showing up - Day 1: no more internet cards, Day 2: network not working, Day 3: working but impossibly slow, Day4: I just didn't bother anymore

Reviews.Title: “Great if you don't mind being out of the city”
Reviews.Author: ilovegalicia
Reviews.Content: I used GTA hotels to book. We booked it because my bf and I were planning on spending one romantic night together and the other nights with friends (ended up spending 3 nights in 3 hotels) and we liked Petra the best. We were confused on how to get IN the hotel though. We ended up following in some guests. Key card stopped working in the morning and the concierge came and let us in without asking our names or anything... it concerned us for security reasons. We liked it overall. If you want to know anything more, just let me know! Only bad thing- way too many Americans!!

Reviews.Title: “Rome in February”
Reviews.Author: Geza189
Reviews.Content: I read a few of the reviews for this Hotel and took the plunge anyway. We stayed there for three nights and I felt that the submitted views were unfair. The staff were excellent and even endured our feeble attempts at italian to order food and beer on the first evening. The next morning we enquired at reception about the bus stop to get into town and received excellent help, they even had bus tickets at reception - 1 euro for 75mins of travel and validate the ticket when you get on the bus. Magic. It gives one bus journey and one metro journey and considering that you can get on the train at Annagnina and then travel all the way to the nearest metro station at the Vatican city it is fabulous value for money. Too many good sights to mention in Rome but I would use the Hotel again as it was very good value for the money paid. Food served in the Hotel restaurant was excellent and there is no chance of being ripped off for coffee or beer from the small bar in reception. (1 euro for a coffee) In all, good Hotel, very clean and the staff were great. No issues at all.

Reviews.Title: “Quite all right, as long as you know what you're getting.”
Reviews.Author: Businesstraveller5
Reviews.Content: The Petra is a pretty good place for a short stay, but--as previous reviews make clear--it's not for everyone. The area in fact is not too bad; the Italian habit of spraying graffiti and litter over everything makes it look a great deal worse than it is. But neither is it romantic, glamorous or atmospheric: rather, a characteristically anonymous Roman suburb in the outer belt (i.e. lots of 1960s apartment blocks, relatively few shops or restaurants, and plenty of busy four-lane roads). It is, I think, best suited for people looking for a convenient and decent-value stopping-place for Ciampino airport. To get there from the airport, the simplest way is to take the CO.TRA.L or A.TRA.L 'bus from the arrivals terminal to Anagnina station (10-15 min.), then switch to the 046 city 'bus that will take you to Via del Ponte di Sette Miglia (6-7 min.). This will deposit you almost outside the front door. It's a short taxi trip, but Roman taxi drivers are almost incredibly ignorant of the geography of their own city. Though the straight-line distance is also fairly short, walking is, alas, impossible: you would be travelling along a divided highway with no walkway and overgrown vegetation forcing you into high-speed oncoming traffic every 50 metres or so. The hotel itself is a typical Italian 4-stelle: large if simply-furnished bedrooms with bath and balcony; plenty of conference rooms; and a pool that doesn't seem to be in use in the winter-time. The breakfast is excellent, with a wide selection of items. I didn't try the restaurant: but with the exception of a couple of indifferent-looking trattorie and pizzerie, there aren't too many alternatives within walking distance. Because of the distance from central Rome, I wouldn't recommend the Petra as a tourist base. If you have a hire car and are exploring the area to the south (Castelgandolfo, etc.) then it might do nicely, if you're prepared to sacrifice ambience for value. Other than that, airport users with an early flight are probably its natural client base: and for them it should prove quite satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there !”
Reviews.Author: sgkhoo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to be near Ciampino Airport...it was incredibly difficult to find, and when I rang up, the front desk couldn't adequately give me directions in English. In saying that, I was of course in Italy and maybe should have been able to speak better Italian, but in an international city such as Rome, it was a bit off putting. I finally found it...in a neighbourhood I would not dare tread through during the day, much less during the night. There was grafitti strewn on numerous walls, and the area was quite deserted at the time of day I was checking in. To access the room, I had to walk through the lobby, past security gates, and found myself on the road again outside the hotel, only to have to cross the road to another security gate before entering another part of the hotel where my room was located. In other words, the hotel's in 2 parts ! The room itself was adequate, but it had shutters, leaving me thinking, maybe this wasn't the safest neighbourhood to be in after all. There was a noticeable foul smell around the balcony area as well which didn't bode well. The pool was closed and not accessible, and to be honest, there was nothing else there to do after that. Food was surprisingly good, and that was probably the only highlight of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One word-don`t!!!!”
Reviews.Author: km_77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Petra Hotel with my wife for 4 nights in 05/2006 after reading good reviews on tripadvisor & seduced by the hotel's flashy website. Once we arrived, after a long bus ride from the nearest metro station (Ananina), we were shocked by how different the hotel looked to the website. The hotel is near what appears to be a dodgy industrial estate & is protected by an automated door, the sort you find in war zones (tells you a thing or two about the area, I suppose). We hoped that the service would make up for the shortcomings of the surroundings but,again, we were disappointed. The staff at the reception desk were positively rude on most occasions when we approached them; for instance the A/C in the room was not functioning (when we complained, the curt response was 'we don`t do A/C until June, despite the fact that it was touching 30C).The only saving grace was the sumptous breakfast but it does not take away the fact that the hotel is definitely not 4 star, is in the middle of nowhere & the staff need to be put through an intensive course on politeness & good manners.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't go there again!”
Reviews.Author: soulsister331
Reviews.Content: A bit of a disappointment! The rooms, when we found them (in a seperate building!) were clean but very basic, no frills but were comfortable enough. The staff were helpful enough until one of our group lost his wallet. The staff whose english was limited, become very unhelpful, refusing to contact the police direct and advising us to go to the police station in person as they didn't want the police to come to the hotel. We ate in the hotel restaurant on 1 occasion and that was not a great experience either, on ordering a fruit salad for dessert, one of our friends was presented with a vegetable salad, despite us all having had our main course already! The service was bad, other people getting served well before us despite us being there for a considerable time. The hotel bar was poorly stocked and the staff seemed unsure of the prices so just seemed to give us a rough estimate of what our drinks cost! The hotel is a good distance from the centre of Rome in what looks like an industrial area but the hotel provides a free shuttle service to the metro where you can catch the tube to anywhere in Rome for 1 Euro. Bad point is the drivers of these shuttlebuses seem to think their Fiats are actually Ferrari's so be prepared for a white knuckle ride! Also the pool was out of action and rather green looking which was a disappointment. Be prepared for lots of graffitti which seems to cover most parts of Rome. I would definitely return to Rome but I would not consider this hotel again and pay the etra for somewhere closer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn`t as expected :(”
Reviews.Author: Nina01
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our 5 days trip in Rome. We were a bit dissapointed by the hotel as we were expecting what was on the pictures of the website. The swimming pool was closed (despite the nice weather) and moldy and tennis course too. The rooms needs a bit of refurb. Also the staff weren`t speaking a good english or none. And not very friendly. They didn`t have an iron available during all our stay and no plug adaptator. There were some positive points though it was a clean hotel, a great breakfast. It doesn`t deserve to be a 4 star definately. We won`t go back there !

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: fr1n3ine
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome, and i can honestly say, stay at the Petra Hotel, i was amazed with the service provided by the staff, it took about 30 mins to get in the town but too be honest it wasnt a problem at all, the Metro is very cheap 1Euro to travel on the bus and train, the bus stop is 2seconds walk and it takes you straight to the train station where you will find a a fab market to purchase makeup, coats, shoes really cheap, definitly recommend the market before going on the train you will find definitly find bargins there. The train station is very simple to find your way round as you will see english translations to exits and enter signs i was very impressed with the trip. The hotel was very nice, the rooms were very clean we had a balcony which was very nice because being in Dec we still had the sun bleeming in, becareful with using the shutters as it makes the room very dark and in the morning you never know what time it is because its pitch black, but if you want to sleep in, i recommend you use it because it is nice ha ha We had a mini bar in the room which i thought it was going to be expensive but when i got the bill and the end of the trip it was seriously nothing, it was so cheap and the breakfast there was lovely. If you are looking to go to Rome, stay at the Petra Hotel because you can get cheap cab fare back to the airport which cost us 50euros and on the way there it cost us 80euros but thats understanable. If you choose Petra Hotel dont take the location into account because you are only going back there to sleep and then out in the day in Rome. The area is very quiet and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad... but also not great!”
Reviews.Author: Lanny_fa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 6 nights. The outside of the hotel seemed nice. The interior and cleanliness of the hotel is excellent. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly. As the hotel was on the outer part of Rome hardly anyone knew how to speak English - but at least tried to be a bit helpful. The breakfast was delightful and very well presented. The dinner which was served was delicious but the service was pretty poor. To start with we were served on time, friendly and in a professional manner but over the period of our time there, the service seemed to lack more and more. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was the right temperature. The balcony was great, except the view was a bit poor. Overall if I went there again I wouldn't be staying there again. It was an ok hotel to stay for a few days but the food seemed tedious and there wasn't much to do to keep me entertained the whole week.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: LovingAmerica
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and found hardly anyone speaks english and has no intrest in doing so! The pool is dirty and the ground floor blinds led us to believe that crime was pretty high there. The kitchen staff have no manners as we were asked too move tables half way through breakfast!!! St Peters is a 15 minute bus ride away then a 17 stop metro ride away, the metro stops running at 9.30pm and there is no cheap way of getting back to the hotel unless you want to spend approx £70 to £120 Euros to get back to the hotel. There is no information to advise you of this as we found out from another english tourist at the hotel and had it confirmed by a local taxi driver. No tea or coffee in the rooms either there should be as this is a 4* star hotel and its just basic stuff. Would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible”
Reviews.Author: MikeWilts
Reviews.Content: We needed somewhere to stay for one night close to Rome Ciampino airport as we had an early check-in. The hotel looks OK from web photos and info but in reality was a bit shabby, reception attitude and service varied from 'basic minimum' to 'completely disinterested' depending on who you saw. Worst thnig is that room air conditioning was totally useless, completely ineffectual. We could not open windows for security reasons, the rooms have metal shutters which notices suggest you keep closed whenever possible. So we spent a very hot and claustrophobic night. Somehow our 3 year old managed to get to sleep, if it wasn't for that we would have been camped by reception till they did something (even a mattress in reception would have been better). Reception staff were more interested in something on their computer screen in the morning than our check-out, whether we enjoyed our stay, all that basic stuff. On the positive side, the restaurant was actually OK, reasonably wide menu, food OK, service pretty good from young staff. The inclusive buffet breakfast was very basic quality. We were very glad to leave in the morning and would rather have slept at the airport. Next time we will either organised a later flight (so we don't need to stay so close) or fly from Rome's main airport where there must be better quality hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: myTXchica
Reviews.Content: Our experience was mixed in that the hotel itself was nice. Big room (rare in europe), very good rate and we enjoyed the room service provided. What tainted our stay was the customer service by the front desk staff, specifically the woman. The directions on the website were incorrect so we got lost. When we called the hotel for help, we received none. Just told we had to get back to the train station and start over. There were other little things too such as trying to book a shuttle to get us back to Ciampino airport which was going to run a hefty 50 euros and they left on their schedule not yours which was inconvenient for out flight time, but the overall stay was good. The hotel is far out, but for the rate it can't be beat. We were pleasantly surprised at the size of the room considering so many we've stayed at in Europe have been the size of a closet.

HotelInfo.Name: Petra Hotel & Residence
HotelInfo.Address: Via Sante Vandi 124, 00173 Rome, Italy
